items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
Relax your shoulders and keep your arms straight by your sides.
Slowly lift your shoulders up towards your ears, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
Hold for a second, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Strengthens the trapezius muscles in the upper back and shoulders
Improves posture and reduces the risk of neck and shoulder pain
Increases grip strength and forearm endurance
Can be done with a variety of weights and equipment, making it accessible for all fitness levels
Isolates the targeted muscles, allowing for focused and effective training
